As he approaches the tower, Tucson surmises that he no longer needs to reso=
rt to his sonar systems and returns to relying on his sensitive hearing to =
get an auditory visual on his surroundings.  He could hear that there was s=
omeone near him, and slowly he rolls right up to Talon and remains in his S=
UV mode.  He wanted to know why there was such a gathering of Maximals.  Ev=
en though he could not see anyone or anything he could hear that there was =
a large gathering at the tower.  Sensing someone next to him, he puts himse=
lf in park so is not to roll accidentally on someone's foot or paw, as the =
case may be.  

" There seems to be a large gathering of some sort.  Do you=
 happen to know why Lord Perseus would warrent such a meeting?"

Enquired t=
he blind Autobot politely.

>   Even though the message had gone out to the Maximals, Tuc=
son could not bare to ignore the radio transmission. He suspaces his cross =
bow over his shoulder, as the mechanisms over his back latch it in place. 
=
> 
> "Sounds like this could be important. I better try to get to the tower=
, and see what the transmission is about. Sorry cross bow, you'll have to w=
ait a while".
> 
> With his sight impaired, he turns to his sonar system at=
op his helmet, and throws off a sonar wave, which he hoped would bounce off=
 the tower, and back to him, giving Tucson the exact coordinates in which t=
o follow. He also knew that being on wheels would be faster than trying to =
go there on foot. Metal plates soon shift and within moments he is transfor=
med into his vehicular mode. The compact SUV shifts himself into all wheel =
drive, and slowly rolls toward the direction of the tower, which he obtains=
 with sonar system capability.
>

wer.

ed the tower.

half our supplies
> > survived the impact. This is the last of it."

> > =

> > "The boss has an announcement," Salveo replied. "He'll be right down,
=

help you have given us over the years,"
> > > said Lord Perseus.

> At the top of the Atlantis tower, the mayor's office had a bird's eye
> >=
 > view of the destroyed city. It had taken three weeks to clear the
> > > =
rubble and begin rebuilding; the Maximal base however, was a total
> > > lo=
ss: only the lower level remained, which merely contained a
> > > destroyed=
 ractor system and the prison cells, which concievably be
> > > modified to=
 be used by the loca police.
> > >
> > > "So you'll be leaving us?" asked t=
he mayor, already knowing the answer.
> > >
> > > "Yes. I've come to the co=
nclusion that our presence in the city
> > > merely aggrivates conditions. =
Without us, this island would become a
> > > much lower priority for our en=
emies. Though I hope we can continue
> > > our research together; and I pro=
mise we will do anything we can to
> > > help the city."
> > >
> > > "So wh=
ere will you be going?" the mayor asked after a moment of silence.
> > >
> =
> > Perseus walked to the windows and sighed.
> > >
> > > "We Maximals have=
 been divided for too long. With this Unicronian
> > > threat, and our rece=
nt truce with Megatron. it would be apropriate for

rences aside and work together. So we'll first be
> > > going to meet with =
Lord Elder."
> > >

ou are always welcome
> > > here."
> > >
